alert.note: Alert for Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 5:03PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Yuma County in northeastern Colorado, Cheyenne and southwestern Thomas Counties in northwestern Kansas, northern Logan County in west central Kansas, southwestern Rawlins, southwestern Sheridan and Sherman Counties in northwestern Kansas, Gove County in west central Kansas and southwestern Dundy Counties in southwestern Nebraska through 545 PM MDT/645 PM CDT/... At 501 PM MDT/601 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Haigler to 4 miles southwest of Brewster to 8 miles south of Collyer. Movement was west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Brewster around 605 PM CDT. Haigler around 505 PM MDT. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 11 and 51, and between mile markers 59 and 98. Highway 385 between mile markers 236 and 251. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Rainfall rates in excess of three inches per hour are possible from the strongest storms. This will produce sharply reduced visibilities as low as one half mile and increase the threat for localized flooding.
